title: Ohms law - resistivity - current in 2 m cylinder

content.question: A long cylinder with a length of <math alttext="2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and a cross-sectional area of <math alttext="0.020 square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.020</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is made from a material of resistivity <math alttext="2.5 ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. What is the current in the cylinder when a potential difference of <math alttext="0.60 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> is applied across its ends?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.0024 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0024</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.015 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.015</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="24 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="150 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.0024 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0024</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
